title: Guide Document for using ubi-minimal and Quarkus and how to diagnose potential vulnerabilities (e.g. from scans)
body:
### Description

When developing a Quarkus based application, I ran into difficulties on how to diagnose potential vulnerabilities reported by Snyk. Is the Quarkus build supply-chain affected?  Is it my code?

Request: Add a guide document on using ubi-minimal and Quarkus and how to check/report/resolve security vulnerabilities. In particular,

* What testing does RedHat recommend (paid, self-serv, open) ?
* Distinguishing between platform (e.g. ubi-minimal) vs. Quarkus vs. Project
* Additional resources (paid and unpaid) for support
* When are vulnerabilities (CVEs) which relate to c-libraries etc of concern to Quarkus developed apps assuming ubi-minimal and Quarkus distributions that do not report these CVEs?  IOW can a CVE that assumes the fault of a system library (non-java) still be present in the Java environment?.

### Implementation ideas

_No response_
